title: Geographic Segmentation and Market Heterogeneity in Chain Retail
abstract: Analysis of regional differences in consumer behavior across 45 US markets. Northeast markets show 19% higher price tolerance but 15% lower visit frequency. West Coast customers prioritize quality (mean rating: 4.3/5) over price. Midwest demonstrates strongest loyalty program engagement (72% enrollment).
key_findings: Northeast: 19% higher price tolerance, 15% lower frequency
West Coast: highest quality preference (4.3/5 avg)
South: most price-sensitive, highest competitor switching
methods: Multi-level modeling, geographic information systems, cluster analysis
